It's great that you're following your doctor's orders and taking it easy for the next six weeks. That's a crucial period for your body to heal and recover.

A herniated disk can be a painful and debilitating condition, and it's no wonder you've been experiencing discomfort since mid-February. It's good that you got a proper diagnosis, and now you can work towards addressing the root cause of the issue.

Given your diagnosis, it's essential to be gentle with your back and avoid any activities that might exacerbate the condition. Your doctor and physical therapist will likely provide you with a customized exercise plan that's tailored to your specific needs and abilities.

In the meantime, here are some additional tips to help you manage your pain and discomfort during this recovery period:

1. **Take regular breaks**: If you need to sit or stand for extended periods, take regular breaks to stretch, move around, and rest your back.
2. **Use proper lifting techniques**: When lifting, bend at the knees, keep the object close to your body, and lift with your legs rather than your back.
3. **Avoid heavy lifting**: Try to avoid lifting heavy objects altogether, or ask for assistance if you need to lift something heavy.
4. **Use heat or cold therapy**: Apply heat or cold packs to the affected area to reduce pain and discomfort.
5. **Maintain good posture**: When sitting or standing, maintain good posture to reduce strain on your lower back.
6. **Stay hydrated**: Drink plenty of water to keep your spinal discs hydrated and healthy.
7. **Get enough sleep**: Aim for 7-9 hours of sleep per night to help your body recover and repair itself.
8. **Manage stress**: Engage in stress-reducing activities like meditation, deep breathing, or yoga to help manage stress and anxiety.

Remember to follow your doctor's orders and attend your physical therapy sessions as scheduled. Your healthcare team will help you develop a personalized plan to manage your pain, improve your mobility, and strengthen your back.

Keep in mind that recovery from a herniated disk takes time, patience, and dedication. It's essential to be gentle with your body and not rush back into activities that might exacerbate the condition. By following your treatment plan and taking care of yourself, you'll be on the path to recovery and reduced pain.

Feel free to ask me any questions or share your progress. I'm here to support you!
